intro: Duidaea rubriceps, commonly known as the red-headed duidaea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red petals and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by specific species of bees and hummingbirds. Duidaea rubriceps is notable for its unique coloration and ecological role in its native habitat.
